summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney and FBI Special Agents regarding requests for historical service provider information for phone numbers associated with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell during an investigation. The document shows coordination between prosecutors and law enforcement on evidence gathering.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Phone numbers associated with his NY office and cell phone are being investigated for service provider information during the relevant time period.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Phone numbers associated with her are being investigated for service provider information during the relevant time period.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/Human Trafficking
persons.context: Correspondent in email chain providing information about phone service providers to the prosecutor.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Initiated request for phone service provider information for Epstein and Maxwell's phone numbers as part of investigation.

connections.description: Both subjects of the same investigation with their phone records being examined together by prosecutors and FBI.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.person2: Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/Human Trafficking
connections.description: Prosecutor requesting and FBI agent providing investigative information about phone service providers.

events.title: Phone records investigation coordination
events.description: Email correspondence between SDNY prosecutor and FBI agents regarding obtaining service provider information for phone numbers associated with Epstein and Maxwell.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/Human Trafficking

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors from SDNY were actively investigating phone records of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell as of May 2019.
The FBI's VCAC/Human Trafficking unit in New York was involved in providing investigative support for the case.
Investigators were seeking historical service provider information from T-Mobile, AT&T, and Verizon for specific phone numbers.
The document shows coordination between federal prosecutors and FBI agents in gathering evidence for the Epstein investigation.
